oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Mrs. Gordon to Capt. A. R. Gordon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written to "my dear husband," a prisoner of war at Johnson's Island, Ohio. Mrs. Gordon laments that it has been a month since she has received a letter from "my dear one." She reports that Pa has gone to Nashville for supplies and that Sis had a typhoid attack. The family is getting along fine compared to their devastated land. Several marriages have taken place. All send their love. Andrew Ruthven Gordon, a slaveholding farmer, was a captain in Co. E, Holman's 11th Tenn. Cav. Regt.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
